about.name: Memphis
about.info_text: Memphis, located in the southwestern part of Tennessee, is a city with a rich musical heritage and a vibrant cultural scene. It is famous for being the home of blues, soul, and rock 'n' roll music. Visitors can explore iconic attractions like Graceland, the former home of Elvis Presley, and enjoy live music on Beale Street. Memphis is also known for its delicious barbecue cuisine and the Mississippi River, which adds to the city's charm.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 651,073
State: Tennessee
Time Zone: Central Time Zone (UTC-06:00)
Language: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Memphis has a humid subtropical climate with hot, muggy summers and mild winters. The city experiences all four seasons, with occasional snowfall in winter.

attractions_card.title: Graceland
attractions_card.description: Graceland, the former home of Elvis Presley, is a must-visit for fans of the King of Rock 'n' Roll. Explore the mansion, Elvis' cars, and his memorabilia.

attractions_card.title: Beale Street
attractions_card.description: Beale Street is a historic street known for its live music venues, restaurants, and vibrant nightlife. It's a hub for blues and jazz music.

attractions_card.title: Sun Studio
attractions_card.description: Sun Studio is often called the 'Birthplace of Rock 'n' Roll' and is famous for recording Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, and other music legends.

attractions_card.alt: Stax Museum of American Soul Music
attractions_card.title: Stax Museum of American Soul Music
attractions_card.description: The Stax Museum celebrates soul music and the artists who recorded hits at Stax Records, featuring exhibits and memorabilia.

attractions_card.title: National Civil Rights Museum
attractions_card.description: The National Civil Rights Museum is located at the Lorraine Motel, where Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated. It offers insights into the civil rights movement.

attractions_card.title: Memphis Zoo
attractions_card.description: The Memphis Zoo is home to a variety of animals and offers an enjoyable experience for visitors of all ages.

attractions_card.title: Mud Island River Park
attractions_card.description: Mud Island River Park features a Riverwalk model, pedal boats, and concerts at the amphitheater along the Mississippi River.

attractions_card.title: Shelby Farms Park
attractions_card.description: Shelby Farms Park is one of the largest urban parks in the United States, offering hiking, biking, and outdoor activities.

food_card.title: Barbecue
food_card.description: Memphis is renowned for its barbecue, with specialties like pulled pork, ribs, and dry rubs. Visit local barbecue joints for an authentic taste.

food_card.title: Soul Food
food_card.description: Explore soul food restaurants in Memphis to savor dishes like fried chicken, collard greens, and cornbread.

food_card.title: Hot Tamales
food_card.description: Hot tamales are a unique local specialty. These spicy, meat-filled treats are a popular snack in Memphis.

food_card.title: Grits and Catfish
food_card.description: Indulge in classic Southern comfort food with dishes like grits and catfish, often served in Memphis restaurants.

hotels_card.title: The Peabody Memphis
hotels_card.description: The Peabody is a historic and luxurious hotel known for the daily March of the Ducks in its lobby and elegant accommodations.

hotels_card.title: Graceland Guest House
hotels_card.description: Stay near Graceland at the Guest House, offering themed rooms, dining options, and easy access to Elvis Presley's former residence.

hotels_card.title: The Guest House at Graceland
hotels_card.description: Another option near Graceland, The Guest House offers comfortable rooms and a lively atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: The Westin Memphis Beale Street
hotels_card.description: This stylish hotel is located on Beale Street, offering easy access to live music and entertainment.

hotels_card.alt: The River Inn of Harbor Town
hotels_card.title: The River Inn of Harbor Town
hotels_card.description: The River Inn is a boutique hotel with river views, providing a tranquil escape in the city.

hotels_card.alt: Holiday Inn Memphis - Downtown Beale St.
hotels_card.title: Holiday Inn Memphis - Downtown Beale St.
hotels_card.description: This Holiday Inn is conveniently located near Beale Street and offers modern comforts.

hotels_card.title: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Memphis
hotels_card.description: The DoubleTree offers comfortable accommodations and easy access to Memphis attractions.

hotels_card.title: Sheraton Memphis Downtown Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Sheraton is a modern hotel in the heart of downtown Memphis, providing a convenient stay.

transport_card.title: Memphis International Airport
transport_card.description: Memphis International Airport (MEM) is the primary airport serving the city, offering domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: MATA Trolley
transport_card.description: The Memphis Area Transit Authority (MATA) offers a trolley system for public transportation within the city.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are available at the airport and throughout the city, providing flexibility for exploring Memphis and its surroundings.
